title: How to Create Carpet Bedding for the Garden

steps.headline: Design a pattern or design clearly by using plants that provide a solid color effect.
steps.description: This effect will be largely achieved from the use of foliage rather than flowers. Few flowering plants have blooms prolific enough to provide the desired consistent result, although they can often be used in combination with the ornamental foliage plants as a contrast and highlight.

steps.headline: Select good quality foliage plants for creating the carpet bedding.
Choose the layout design.
Choose the color combination.
Plant the plants.
steps.description: In setting these plants in the bed, be governed by the habit of each plant. Achyranthes and Alternanthera, being the smallest, should be put about four inches apart. Give the Coleus about six inches of leeway, also the Centaurea. Allow eight inches for Madame Salleroi Geranium and Pyrethrum. These will soon meet in the row and form a solid line or mass of foliage.

steps.headline: Care for the carpet bedding.
